info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 15 at 3:54PM EDT until August 15 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR ALAMANCE AND NORTHWESTERN CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 354 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Carrboro, or 7 miles west of Chapel Hill, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Graham, Mebane, Haw River, Swepsonville, Alamance, Snow Camp, Sutphin and Saxapahaw. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. This storm is producing destructive winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
